key_title: Key to the species of Nicotiana

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Solanaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Solanaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Solanaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Perennial soft-wooded shrub or small tree to 6 m high; corolla yellow
Annual or short-lived perennial herb to 3 m high; corolla white or pink
Plant 1–3 m high; filaments of all stamens inserted near base of corolla-tube; inflorescence short, dense, panicle-like; corolla white or pink
Plant usually less than 1 m high; filaments of 4 stamens inserted near summit of corolla-tube; inflorescence elongated, loose, panicle- or raceme-like, or flowers solitary in axils; corolla white
Leaves radical and cauline, upper ones subsessile to sessile; corolla white, trumpet- shaped; corolla-tube 65–85 mm long
Leaves nearly all cauline, upper ones shortly petiolate; corolla white to pink, funnel- shaped; corolla-tube 30–55 mm long
Plant pubescent or velvety with soft woolly hairs on all parts
Plant glabrous or almost so (more or less glandular-hairy on flowers and sometimes sparsely hairy on lower stems)
Corolla-tube less than 20 mm long, less than 3 mm wide at apex of calyx, limb less than 12 mm diam.; seeds C-shaped
Corolla-tube 20–55 mm long, mostly 3–5 mm wide at apex of calyx, limb 14–35 mm diam.; seeds reniform or angled
